metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3158 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The xrstor function in arch/x86/xstate.c in Xen 4.x does not properly handle writes to the hardware FSW.ES bit when running on AMD64 processors, which allows local guest OS users to obtain sensitive register content information from another guest by leveraging pending exception and mask bits.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incorrect fix for CVE-2013-2076.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3158` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.6 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
libxenstore3.0 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xen-hypervisor-4.5-amd64 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xen-hypervisor-4.5-arm64 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xen-hypervisor-4.5-armhf - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xen-hypervisor-4.6-amd64 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xen-hypervisor-4.6-arm64 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xen-hypervisor-4.6-armhf - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xen-system-amd64 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
